news.title: British paratrooper who died in Ukraine named
news.summary: Lance Corporal George Hooley was named by Sir Keir Starmer in the Commons during PMQs.

news.title: Man guilty of murdering ex-girlfriend's sister and three children in house fire
news.summary: Bryonie Gawith and her children Denisty, Oscar and Aubree Birtle died in their home in Bradford.

news.title: Author Sophie Kinsella dies aged 55
news.summary: The author of the Shopaholic series of novels had been diagnosed with an aggressive form of brain cancer.

news.title: Sperm from donor with cancer-causing gene was used to conceive almost 200 children
news.summary: Some children have already died and only a minority who inherit the mutation will escape cancer in their lifetimes.

news.title: US could ask UK tourists for five-year social media history before entry
news.summary: The plan would affect people from countries, including the UK, which can fill out a form in lieu of a visa.

news.title: Can you solve GCHQ's Christmas code-cracking challenge?
news.summary: Do you have what it takes to crack GCHQ's Christmas codes?

news.title: Madeleine McCann's father tells BBC how his family was hounded by press
news.summary: Gerry McCann, whose daughter vanished in 2007, tells the BBC he believes politicians fear the media.

news.title: Spat at, attacked and threatened by schoolkids - life as a bus driver in Britain
news.summary: The BBC has spoken to passengers, transport staff and bus drivers about a growing national trend of antisocial behaviour on public transport.

news.title: How monogamous are humans? Scientists compile 'league table' of pairing up
news.summary: When it comes to monogamy, humans more closely resemble meerkats and beavers than our primate cousins.

news.title: Ukraine 'ready for elections' if partners guarantee security, Zelensky says
news.summary: He was speaking after US President Donald Trump repeated claims Kyiv was "using war" to avoid elections.
